actions.text: On agreeing to the Matheson amendment Agreed to by recorded vote: 355 - 48 (Roll no. 213).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A004) offered by Mr. Matheson.
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Matheson amendment Agreed to by recorded vote: 355 - 48 (Roll no. 213).
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House

description: Amendment gave priority to small businesses and organizations, in the awarding of SBIR, STTR, and FAST grants, that are making significant contributions towards energy efficiency, including those that are making efforts to reduce their carbon footprint or are carbon neutral.
purpose: An amendment numbered 4 printed in House Report 110-603 to give priority to small businesses and organizations, in the awarding of SBIR, STTR, and FAST grants, that are making significant contributions towards energy efficiency, including those that are making efforts to reduce their carbon footprint or are carbon neutral.
